divs: Sighting DetailsI was Star gazing in my back yard when I noticed a bright light in NNE sky abot 65 degrees above. Light was not from an aircraft. I live in Tampa air traffic pattern , and am a veteran of naval aviation. Object was traveling SSW as it disapeared leading me to believe it was losing altitude at a fast pace but was much to slow to be a meteor. Light was constant, did not flicker and left to "tail" as a meteor would.Also there was no sound. It seems to me all satellites from earth travel in a polar orbit or west to east or eliptical like ISS. I'm not familiar with any satellites that travel east to west, or am I mistaken?
Summary: I saw a bright object at extreme huigh altitude as it disapeared in the shadow of the Earth
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Port Richey
There were no other sightings in Port Richey on or around October 9th 2010
